channel.title: Custom Clan Wars

item.title: Custom Clan Wars
item.dc:creator: @Chicken_guy Chicken guy
item.description:
@Chicken_guy wrote:

This is a custom clan wars and may be a little too custom for some people!

Ok first I give all credits to this guy http://forum.ragezone.com/f365/tut-custom-clan-wars-317-a-492309/#post5469852

His post was censored in some areas so I fixed that up and changed a few things

First- Post this command.

if (command.startsWith("clanwars")) { teleportToX = 3304; teleportToY = 3123; sendMessage("Welcome to Clan Wars! (CLICK CHEST FOR CAPE!) Note: Items lost on death!"); }

Second- Add these objects

/*Beggin Clan Wars*/
	       makeGlobalObject(3301, 3127, 4387, 0, 10);
	       makeGlobalObject(3305, 3127, 4388, 0, 10);
	       makeGlobalObject(3300, 3125, 7351, 0, 10);
                  makeGlobalObject(3306, 3125, 8798, 0, 10);

/* end clan wars */

This make the table give food and the chests give capes.


if(objectID == 7351) {
		addItem(4373, 1);
}
if(objectID == 8798) {
		addItem(4399, 1);
}
if(objectID == 4458) {
		addItem(4049, 1);
}

Then add this:

	if (objectID == 4387) {
            if (playerHasItem(1854)) {
                toX = 3258;
                toY = 3084;
            	deleteItem(1854, 1);
	    }
             else {
                sM("You need a shantay pass from your clan leader!!");
            }
        }
             if (objectID == 4388) {
            if (playerHasItem(1854)) {
		toX = 3258;
                toY = 3120;
		deleteItem(1854, 1);
            }
             else {
                sM("You need a shantay pass from your clan leader!!");
            }
        }

Basically all that does is require a shantay pass to enter the portal. You can make a shop to buy them or give them to a clan leader.
When a player has a shantay pass they can enter the portal. Once they’re in the game the pass dissapears.

Add this to make it a wildy zone.


(absY <= 3122 && absY >= 3082 && absX <= 3265 && absX >= 3122)

Again I do not take credit for this post! Well… maybe like .00001% for fixing up the missing coords and editing it a little. For
those who think it looks a little too custom you can always change out the items you dislike. (ex: the tall pillars on the side)

If I missed anything from the original tutorial please say so. Note: I did not add the gfx and emotes for when a player ate the food just because I found it annoying.

Read full topic
